                              String panel)

      • showSessionDialog

        public void showSessionDialog(Session session,
                              String panel,
                              boolean recreateUISharedContexts)

      • showSessionDialog

        public void showSessionDialog(Session session,
                              String panel,
                              boolean recreateUISharedContexts,
                              Runnable postInitRunnable)
        Shows the session properties dialog. If a panel is specified, the dialog is opened showing that panel. If recreateUISharedContexts is true, any old UI shared contexts are discarded and new ones are created as copies of the contexts. If a postInitRunnable is provided, its Runnable.run() method is called after the initialization of all the panels of the session properties dialog.
        Parameters:
        session - the session
        panel - the panel name to be shown
        recreateUISharedContexts - if true, any old UI shared contexts are discarded and new ones are created as copies of the contexts
        postInitRunnable - if provided, its Runnable.run() method is called after the initialization of all the panels of the session properties dialog.

      • addContext

      • addContextPanelFactory

        public void addContextPanelFactory(ContextPanelFactory contextPanelFactory)
        Description copied from interface: ViewDelegate
        Adds the given context panel factory to the view delegate.

        The factory will be called whenever a panel is required for a context and notified when a context (or contexts) are no longer needed.

        Specified by:
        addContextPanelFactory in interface ViewDelegate
        Parameters:
        contextPanelFactory - the context panel factory that should be added
        See Also:
        ViewDelegate.removeContextPanelFactory(ContextPanelFactory)

      • removeContextPanelFactory

        public void removeContextPanelFactory(ContextPanelFactory contextPanelFactory)
        Description copied from interface: ViewDelegate
        Removes the given context panel factory from the view delegate, and any previously created panels for the contexts.
        Specified by:
        removeContextPanelFactory in interface ViewDelegate
        Parameters:
        contextPanelFactory - the context panel factory that should be removed
        See Also:
        ViewDelegate.addContextPanelFactory(ContextPanelFactory)

      • getPopupMenu

        public MainPopupMenu getPopupMenu()
        Returns a new MainPopupMenu instance with the pop pup menu items returned by the method getPopupList().

        Note: Pop up menu items (JMenuItem, JMenu, ExtensionPopupMenuItem and ExtensionPopupMenu) should be added/removed to/from the list returned by the method getPopupList() not by calling the methods MainPopupMenu#addMenu(...) on the returned MainPopupMenu instance. Adding pop up menu items to the returned MainPopupMenu instance relies on current implementation of MainPopupMenu which may change without notice (moreover a new instance is created each time the method is called).

        Specified by:
        getPopupMenu in interface ViewDelegate
        Returns:
        a MainPopupMenu containing the pop up menu items that are in the list returned by the method getPopupList().
        See Also:
        getPopupList(), MainPopupMenu, ExtensionPopupMenu, ExtensionPopupMenuItem

      • getPopupList

        public Vector<JMenuItem> getPopupList()
        Returns the list of pop up menu items that will have the MainPopupMenu instance returned by the method getPopupMenu().

        Should be used to dynamically add/remove pop up menu items (JMenuItem, JMenu, ExtensionPopupMenuItem and ExtensionPopupMenu) to the main pop up menu at runtime.

        Returns:
        the list of pop up menu items that will have the main pop up menu.
        See Also:
        getPopupMenu(), ExtensionHookMenu.addPopupMenuItem(ExtensionPopupMenu), ExtensionHookMenu.addPopupMenuItem(ExtensionPopupMenuItem), MainPopupMenu, ExtensionPopupMenu, ExtensionPopupMenuItem

      • getSplashScreen

        public Component getSplashScreen()
        Gets the splash screen as Component. It should be used only as a parent for error/warning dialogues shown during initialisation.
        Returns:
        the splash screen, null when the splash screen is/was not displayed.
        Since:
        2.4.0

      • setMainToolbarVisible

        public void setMainToolbarVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets whether or not the main tool bar should be visible.
        Parameters:
        visible - true if the main tool bar should be visible, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2.5.0

      • displayMessage

        public void displayMessage(Message message)
        Displays the given message in the main message panels (Request/Response).

        If the given message is null the panels are cleared.

        Note: Current implementation just supports HTTP messages. Attempting to display other message types has no effect.

        Specified by:
        displayMessage in interface ViewDelegate
        Parameters:
        message - the message to display
        See Also:
        ViewDelegate.getRequestPanel(), ViewDelegate.getResponsePanel()
